    • Method Detail

      • whichPlayerGoesFirst

        java.lang.String whichPlayerGoesFirst()
        This method should determine which player should go first, based on rules, or potentially, a sub game (guess the highest prime number, etc)...
        Returns:
        the name of the player that should be first to play.

      • isMovePossible

        boolean isMovePossible()
        This method should determine if another move is available to the players. Needs proper implementation. Next implementation will require additional paramaters passed.
        Returns:
        if the move is possible in the current game.

      • flipPieces

        void flipPieces()
        Deprecated. 3.0
        This was originally how actions would occur on the Othello game, now implemented individually on actionPieces.
        See Also:
        actionPieces(Move, Board, Player)

      • actionPieces

        boolean actionPieces(Move m,
                   Board b,
                   Player p)
        This method should determine if a move should be actionable or not.
        Parameters:
        m - Move that the player/system is making.
        b - Board of the move.
        p - Player making the move
        Returns:
        if the action should occur.

      • checkMove

        boolean checkMove(Move m)
        Parameters:
        m - The Move to check.
        Returns:
        True if the move is OK/Valid.
